channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Economists say America’s gender wage gap is getting worse again—the first major setback for working women in 20 years
item.description: The Labor Department’s chief economist said it’s too soon to tell whether 2023 was a blip or the start of a worrisome new trend.

item.title: Morgan Stanley's stock surging toward all-time high after earnings top targets
On average, every high school has one ‘ultra-high-earning’ teen who makes $10,000 via online hustles
item.description: Thanks to TikTok, Depop, and Twitch, making money online has replaced the paper round.

item.title: ASML just gave us a first glimpse into how U.S. chip export curbs will dent its China sales
item.description: ASML on Tuesday offered the first glimpse into how U.S. restrictions on exports of its advanced chip manufacturing tools to China will impact its sale...

item.title: Stifel’s Barry Bannister sticks to his bearish market stance
item.description: The stock market strategist isn't bothered by the stock market’s run to record highs.

item.title: GM to invest $625 million in joint venture to mine EV battery raw materials in U.S.
item.description: The deal is centered on the development, construction and operation of a lithium carbonite mining operation called Thacker Pass in Humboldt County, Ne...

item.title: Amazon gadget boss hints at ‘awesome’ future Alexa products and unveils a slew of new Kindle devices in his public debut
item.description: Amazon's Panos Panay hinted that the new Alexa would elicit "emotion" and "connection." “The products coming,” he added, “are pretty awesome.”

item.title: U.S. import prices fell for a second straight month in September
Lower oil prices are welcomed by consumers but a bad sign for the global economy
Amazon goes nuclear, to invest more than $500 million to develop small modular reactors
item.description: Amazon is the latest large tech company to buy into nuclear power to fuel the growing demands from data centers.

item.title: Silicon Valley is pouring billions into nuclear energy because without it, the U.S. risks ‘browning the grid’
item.description: Announcements from Google, Microsoft, and Amazon could be the “inflection point” that makes scaling up AI truly possible.

item.title: Novavax shares slump 16% as FDA puts clinical hold on vaccine candidates
Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson knows about working with people you disagree with—and learned this strategy from her own mentor
item.description: "One of the most important things is to try not to take anything personally."

item.title: Record revenue in Morgan Stanley’s wealth-management business
Amazon announces first Kindle ever with color screen, retailing for $279
item.description: The company is refreshing its entire e-reader lineup, launching four new Kindle devices.
